title: Human-Mobility Interaction Graph Learning Design for Smart Mobility Systems

context.prior_knowledge: Elementary statistics, linear algebra, programming (Python), and fundamental machine learning concepts
context.additional_context: Graduate-level applied mathematics education course for learners in specialized technical fields. Composed of asynchronous learning using personal devices (BYOD), with project-based assessments evaluating real-life problem-solving abilities

learning_goals: Participants can explain methodologies for representing multimodal data (text, video, sensor data) as graph structures.
Participants can extract core concepts of human-mobility interaction (HMI) by utilizing cross-modality graph fusion techniques.
Participants can apply HMI graph learning models to real-world smart mobility scenarios (e.g., intersection navigation, pedestrian interaction).
difficulty: Moderate - Standard complexity with some constraints
